sys_metadata_link.payload:
true
All incidents must be logged regardless of the method used to report an incident. For example, a service desk analyst with the itil role, can create an incident directly from the Incident application. A second or third level support user assigned the itil role can also create an incident from the application. The incident is created in state New, and the support user enters all the important information relevant to the incident.

Review proven practice recommendations for the incident form and configure the form layout by adding, rearranging, or removing fields.

]]>
false incident_form_layout 3 6 false true When creating an incident, capture all the important information so that support groups have all the information they require to assist with incident resolution/recovery process. The following screenshot displays the proven practice form for creating an incident from the application:
 
 
Figure 1. Modified Incident form
 
Update the incident form to capture the relevant information:
 Field Description  Comments 
 Affected user Person who is affected by the incident. Field to differentiate the caller from the affected user.
 Assignment group Support group the incident is assigned to. Mandatory on save so that there are no orphan records. 
 Description More information about the issue. Mandatory so that users can provide detailed information required for the troubleshooting process.
 
The service desk user populates the Caller field with the name of the person, who is reporting the incident. The caller may or may not be the person affected by the incident, for example, an administrative assistant reporting an incident on behalf of the executive.

In these scenarios, the Affected user field can be used to capture information about the person affected by the incident. This ensures that the right person is notified about incident-related updates. By default, the affected user can be same as the caller and the person creating an incident should update the affected user field if required.

To configure the incident form based on proven practice recommendations:

  1. Click the context menu and select Configure > Form Layout.
  2. Create a new field Affected user of type reference, which should be a reference to the User [sys_user] table. If the Affected user field is empty, auto populate the field with caller information.
  3. If the Affected user field is added to the form, add or update the Hint text for the following fields:
     Field  Description 
     Affected user Person affected by the incident.
     Caller Person, who reported the incident.
  4. Update the Hint text for the following fields:
     Field  Description 
     Business service Service affected
     Configuration item  Item affected
  5. Create a data policy to set the Assignment group field as mandatory.
  6. Note: You should not be able to select a service Configuration item (CI) in the Configuration item field as the Business service field captures this information. Add a filter to the Configuration item field [cmdb_ci] via dictionary override to filter out business services.
